@LouiseCrowley2 They're reviewing the LC at the moment, great opportunity to fix these issues.

So, when we talk about rote learning, about students not thinking for themselves, when we talk about changing the LC, maybe we should talk about alternative ways to get into college. The points race dominates.
Why? Because the Leaving Cert leads to college places. This is a huge issue. Get it wrong for the students and they don't get into college. That's all we want, to get it right for the students.

We, parents and teachers and thus students, are worried about THE EXAM, the Leaving Cert. This dominates and we don't want to make a mistake and ruin the students' chances of success. So we fall back on what has been 'right' before and make them learn that.
Again this is partly down to moving from 15 to 18, not wanting to put their head above the parapet. But we, as teachers, have to look to see how we have contributed to this. And so do parents.

Simply growing up counts for a lot here. They have been, carefully, shown that maybe their answer wasn't the right one, that they can be wrong. But somewhere they start to be afraid to write down their own thoughts and ideas.
